description:

Requirements:

  • Minimum three (3) years of experience in launching products to the market.
  • Minimum five (5) years of industry experience in mechanical product design.

  • Proficient in 3D & 2D CAD modeling in Solidworks/Catia
  • Hands-on experience and working knowledge of FEA and CFD analysis for structural, cooling/heating, and vibration

title: FUNCTIONAL SAFETY DESIGN ENGINEERING LEAD
description:
Location: San Jose, CA/ Toronto,Canada

In this role, you will be a part of the ASIC Design team working on the processor roadmap. Specific responsibilities of the Functional Safety Design Engineering Lead include:

  • Lead the oversight of safety-related design elements for each ASIC to ensure compliance with the ISO 26262 standard and safety case completion
  • Lead the methodology effort and associated tool choices for implementing and measuring FuSa compliance across the entire chip design
  • Lead communication efforts to the team on current FuSa design status, verification coverage, and top-level measurement criteria
  • Manage the FuSa topics between the ASIC and Software teams to ensure top-level FuSa goals are met
  • A primary point of contact for all safety-related concerns during development and proactively working to resolve identified issues
  • Collaborating with OEM and Tier1 partners to ensure that all aspects of the joint safety engineering development are carried out on time and according to plan
  • Own the product assessments by customers and assessors to demonstrate ISO 26262 product compliance

Requirements:

  • Experience in the development of safety-related automotive ICS
  • Possess an understanding of ISO 26262
  • Experience working with assessors and customers in support of functional safety audits
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrate successful leadership of an IC project with proven compliance to ISO 26262 is preferred
  • Experience leading safety management efforts for the production of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) or autonomous driving platforms
  • Relevant safety personnel certifications (e.g. CFSP, CFSE, or equivalent)
  • A proven record of achieving system safety certifications from third-party assessors such as TUEV SUED, Exida, or equivalent

title: ASIC DESIGN MANAGER
description:
Location:- San Jose, CA

  • As Manager of the ASIC Design team, you will responsible for the Architecture, Design, Implementation, Bring-Up/Characterization & Qualification for all new product development.
  • Your scope will include program management for ASIC projects with a focus on “first time right” methodology project ownership for the development and execution of the schedule/budget throughout the project.

Review and communicate cross-functional program issues and risks through the development cycle and ensure IC, systems and software teams are coordinated and deliver to schedule.

  • Work with customers, consultants and Standards bodies to meet ISO26262 safety compliance targets for automotive ASIC projects.
  • Develop product documentation for both internal and external audiences.
  • Engage with third party developers and outsource partners, where necessary, to define, develop and deliver the product on time and on budget.
  • Work closely with the Software Engineering team on development plans and schedules for RTOS, application firmware, performance tuning and demonstration platforms.
  • Act as the primary interface to the Product Engineering team to meet all validation, characterization and qualification goals for the product.
  • Support key customer engagements as needed.

Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of industry experience in ASIC design
  • Experience with advanced semiconductor process nodes
  • Significant experience with SoC architecture and front-end design
  • Experience with ASIC design methodology & a mind set for tool automation
  • Hands on experience with synthesis & low power design
  • Experience working with a physical design team on IC implementation
  • Experience interfacing directly with a semiconductor fab for design tapeouts
  • Experience with SoC bring-up & software integration
  • FPGA emulation background a plus
  • Image Signal Processing design experience a plus
  • Computer vision processing for ADAS & autonomous vehicles a plus

title: RTL Design Engineer
description:
SpanIdea is a global product engineering solution and services company with a track record of delivering successful products for leading multinational companies and start-ups. SpanIdea is headquartered in Milpitas, USA with R&D offices in Sweden, Singapore, and India. As an industry leader, we are delivering R&D and engineering services to global tier 1 customers on Embedded, Telecom, Automotive, IoT, Cloud, AI, and Mobility.

We are looking for a qualified and highly motivated candidate to lead the RTL Development for GNSS SOC that would power many location services. This would involve in the development of RTL blocks and subsequent implementations. This will be a hands-on position, designing/implementing critical RTL blocks. 

Requirements 

  • MS or PhD degree emphasis in ASIC design 
  • Five or more years of experience in RTL design using Verilog and System Verilog 
  • Experience in developing & optimizing RTL blocks and test and verification of DSP blocks 
  • Previous exposure to physical layer of communication chips such as Wi-Fi, BLE, GNSS, or cellular is a plus 
  • Design of state machines, data paths, arbitration, and clock domain crossing logic 
  • Logic synthesis support, FPGA implementation, Timing constraints 
  • Exposure to Design for Test, understanding of scan concept and writing DFT friendly RTL 
  • Unified Power Format for simulation, synthesis, and electrical rule checking Equivalence checking 
  • Accurate power estimation for RTL blocks 
  • Committed to producing high-quality design 
  • Team player and excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills

  • Five or more years of experience in RTL design using Verilog and System Verilog

  • Experience in developing & optimizing DSP related RTL blocks and test and verification of DSP blocks

  • Previous exposure to physical layer of communication chips such as Wi-Fi, BLE, GNSS, or cellular is a plus

  • Design of state machines, data paths, arbitration, and clock domain crossing logic

  • Logic synthesis support, FPGA implementation, Timing constraints

  • Exposure to Design for Test, understanding of scan concept and writing DFT friendly RTL

  • Unified Power Format for simulation, synthesis, and electrical rule checking Equivalence checking

  • Accurate power estimation for RTL blocks

  • Committed to producing high-quality design

  • Team player and excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills

title: Program Manager - Audio
description:
Education:  BS in engineering or relevant technical field. MSc/PhD is a plus

We are seeking an experienced Program Manager to join  a fast-growing Emerging Technologies Division. In this position, you will be responsible for driving and prioritizing the advanced technology roadmap for the division leveraging a combination of market, user, and technical insight to deliver differentiated product capabilities with demonstrably meaningful customer value. You will partner with the Sr. Directors of the Emerging Technology Division, along with product designers, engineers, and applied research teams to define and prioritize a compelling portfolio of innovative initiatives with a focus on creating the foundation for product experiences that surprise and delight customers. You must follow best practices and align with company goals while creating better procedures and solutions to increase the speed and impact of technology innovation into the product portfolio to drive meaningful customer value.

 

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Work in cross-functional team including members from advanced research, software and hardware engineering, design, and marketing to identify critical technology work streams, tie them to demonstrable customer value, and drive continued innovation in those domains.

• Partner with Emerging Technology team members in the creation of new research proposals to ensure customer value proposition and validate high level technical feasibility. Provide guidance and mentorship to team connecting technical research with customer needs.

• Build and deploy data-driven strategic frameworks for prioritizing technology and concept development work leveraging customer, technology, and market insights

• Work with engineering team members to gather and define HW/SW platform design objectives and business goals.

• Recommend internal and external process improvements and excellence conversations cross functionally to ensure we have optimized processes for translating front end technology innovation into meaningful customer impact.

• Engage with leadership across business units to help define the HW/SW platform roadmap and create recommendations for executive approval.

• Adjust, influence and communicate the requirements and expectations to translate aspirational prototype experiences into feasibly deliverable ones. 

• Work with the other functional and product leaders in the category business team to understand and help shape the multi-year category strategy and product pipeline

• Work with engineering to drive internal alignment on technology platform investment POR.  

• Research competition and broader market trends to identify threats and opportunities in new technologies

• Create, maintain, and disseminate technology advancement project communication to stakeholders.

• Drive alignment and advocacy with external teams on the strategic fit and relevance for front end investigations and investments within the broader category and corporate-wide portfolio

 

Job Requirements:

• Customer-oriented
• Deep passion and insight for delivering value through innovation and technical excellence
• Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude and demonstrable strategic thinking abilities
• Ability to work in environments where requirements are loose and fuzzy while helping identify actionable work that gets answers necessary to move concepts towards productization
• Understanding of market research and data analysis
• Proven track record influencing decision making
• Proven experience as an engineering leader, product manager, or product design lead

DSP (Digital signal processing)

Firmware/DSP Engineer

Job Description

We are looking for a qualified and highly motivated candidate for the development of signal processing algorithms in firmware and subsequent implementations for our products running on embedded processor in our chips. This will be a hands-on position, designing/implementing critical algorithms. The individual will be writing DSP algorithms to run on the embedded ARM processor such as implementing digital filtering, timing and frequency tracking loops, Kalman filtering.

  • Proficient in Embedded C programming
  • Working knowledge of MATLAB is a plus
  • Committed to producing high quality, well designed software
  • Team player and excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills

title: Security Engineer III
description:
Responsibilities:

• Lead a team of security engineers to ensure adequate security solutions and controls are in place throughout all IT systems and applications to mitigate identified risks sufficiently, and to meet business objectives and regulatory requirements

• Lead the architecture, design, and implementation of standard security infrastructure solutions and components

• Assess and understand Samsung’s current security posture and future architecture, providing recommendations for improvement and risk reduction

• Drive strategic programs for critical business units in compliance with regulatory requirements

• Evaluate and develop secure solutions, based on approved security architectures

• Research, design, and advocate new security technologies, architectures, and products that will support security requirements for the enterprise and its customers, and business partners

• Contribute to the development and maintenance of the information security strategy

• Analyze business impact and exposure, based on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities, and risks

• Develop the business, information, and technical artifacts that constitute the enterprise information security architecture and solutions

• Communicate, drive accountability, and manage to closure security risks and solutions with business partners

• Conduct security architecture/application reviews to assess technical and business risk, identify threats and potential areas for abuse in applications, specify solutions, verify through testing, and determine the right level of architecture activity and project oversight based on risk

• Translate security requirements into architectures and specific technology implementations

• Deliver security roadmaps to address application security issues in a risk-based, prioritized order and drive implementation across multiple teams

• Work as Development Security Operations (DevSecOp) Engineer with product managers to analyze, review and help identify vulnerabilities and security risks in internally developed products and applications

• Perform Cloud security assessments for third-party hosted infrastructure and provide hardening controls for secure implementation.

• Embrace a culture of continuous service improvement and service excellence

• Mentor and train other technical team members throughout the company. Minimum

Qualifications:

• B.S. / B.A. in a technical or engineering field, Computer Science, Information Systems.

• 5 years of experience managing an Information Security team or IR function

• 2 or more years of successful program management experience

• Ability to develop and leverage frameworks to structure team thinking, facilitate alignment on key strategic decisions across stakeholders, and reach insightful, actionable answers.

• Direct work experience in a technical project management capacity, including all aspects of process development and execution.

• Ability to influence cross-functional team members.

• Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment. • Ability to quickly adapt to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

• Ability to challenge and debate issues of prioritization to the organization. • Ability to look at situations from several points of view.

• Ability to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.

• Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.

• Excellent relationship builder, open to direction and collaborative work style, and commitment to get the job done.

• Experience with estimating costs, timelines, and resource requirements.

• Experience with secure development lifecycle strategies, process flows, and working in a dynamic environment.

• Superior judgment, problem resolution, team building, negotiation, decision-making skills.

• Ability to successfully navigate between tactical and strategic objectives.

• Manages confidentiality without exception.

title: Cycle Counter/ Auditor
description:
Jon Title: Cycle Counter/ Auditor

Job Location: SF Bay Area, California

Role:

• Monitor inventory integrity by performing daily cycle counts to maintain established accuracy goals

• Review inventory transactions to resolve inventory discrepancies

• Perform inventory adjustments in SAP to correct discrepancies

• Report inventory shortage adjustments to Supervisor to avoid stock-outs, and no-stocks

• Maintain records for inventory accuracy trends, inventory reconciliations, fiscal year-end inventory audit

• Perform random receipt audits and advises Purchasing/Supply Chain of discrepancies

• Identify potential areas for inventory discrepancies and reports to Supervisor

• Maintain product identification such as part numbers and product identification tags and labels

• Follow workplace 6S standards

• Assists with periodic (at least annual) physical inventory audits

• Operates forklift truck or order picker experience helpful not necessary

Requirements

You Bring:

• Demonstrate communication skills (verbal and non-verbal) with all levels of management and the ability to present data in levels of detail appropriate for the audience

• Demonstrate interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and apply knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation

• Intel Server Linux set up, bring up,and FPGA emulation board integration, testing and debug (Ubuntu, Fedora, RH)

• Advanced knowledge and development experience with PCIe/NVMe and DDR3/DDR4 interfaces.

title: DSP/CV Architect, SoC SW Development
description:
DSP/CV ARCHITECT, SoC SW DEVELOPMENT 

Location: San Jose, CA

Job Description
As a software architect, you will join a team of software engineers to create highly optimized computer vision and machine learning kernels for specialized DSP hardware. You will use your design abilities, coding expertise, and creativity to help deliver state-of-the-art real-time firmware and kernel-mode drivers for a low-power, high-performance computer vision accelerator engine. You will work across organizations to understand software requirements, efficiently mapping complex algorithms to the VLIW/SIMD hardware, integrate computer vision algorithms into a production firmware solution, and benchmark/optimize their performance.
This includes the software environments to help customers design and develop applications for all the compute subsystems on SoC including the ARM compute cluster, computer vision sub-system, image signal processor, system management unit, and boot and security blocks. This role will work in close partnership with the hardware platforms team and system solutions team to collectively drive the engineering efforts across. The ideal candidate will also significantly expand and fully build out the team for MLSoC development and will own and drive the CI/CD environment.
Areas of Focus
•    Create a software architecture for future programmable vision processors and enhance the functionality of the latest generation products.
•    Design and write custom embedded software for vision processor engines to meet specific system and hardware requirements at the SoC level.
•    Help define forward-looking strategy and improvements to the vision algorithms and system architecture.
•    Review hardware specifications and map algorithms to the architecture.
•    Ensure creation of extensive testing/validation for new hardware features in emulators and simulators.
•    Participate in the bring-up of the new generation of the world’s most advanced SoC.
•    Provide technical support and guidance for internal and external customers.
Job Requirements
• Ph.D. or MS in electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience.
•    10+ years of working experience in the embedded industry, including 5+ years in a technical leadership role.
•    Deep understanding of SoC principles, general systems architectures, operating systems, device drivers, memory management, multithreading, and real-time scheduling.
•    Deep understanding and working experience with embedded architectures including DSP, computer vision, image/signal processing, and robotics systems in general.
•    Excellent software development skills (C, C++) and outstanding problem-solving capabilities.
•    Proven expertise in architecting embedded software and development of highly optimized code for DSP, SIMD, and/or VLIW processors.
•    Experience with embedded Linux and/or QNX.
•    Outstanding interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a global and diverse team operating in a fast-paced environment.
•    Good understanding of safety-critical software principles with experience in automotive or other highly regulated industries.
Additional Qualifications (good to have)
•    Experience with ISO 26262 and IEC 61508 or equivalent quality/safety processes.
•    Understanding software safety and safety development processes is a major plus.
•    Proven track record to effectively guide and influence in a strong, technically dynamic environment.
Benefits and Perks
•    Our flexible work environment encourages personal and family time off, as well as paternity and maternity leave.
•    Competitive total compensation package, including stock awards, 401k, and employee assistance program.
•    Even though we are a startup, we want all of our employees and their families to have the best health and dental coverage and have the peace of mind they are well protected.
•    Cross-training opportunities available to support learning and career growth.
•    Quarterly peer-to-peer recognition program fosters acknowledgment for outstanding contributions.
•    Meals and snacks are available in our office locations.

title: Machine Learning Architect
description:
Job Description:
•    Provide machine learning solutions to intricate problems related to C-V2X connected cars such as safe driving, security, low latency edge computing, etc.
•    Work together with system architects and software engineers to design machine learning systems and data processing pipelines based on application requirements.
•    Research state-of-the-art methods and identify pros and cons, provide improved solutions, and decide on development tools and frameworks. 
•    Work on the massive volume of raw data to clean, extract, and refine datasets to train, evaluate, test, and tweak models iteratively until the solution meets the requirements.
•    Work across teams with software and testing engineers to deploy machine learning models into the production stack, provide model simplification and optimization if necessary.

Job Requirements:
•    Ph.D or Master’s degree in EE or Computer Science with related industry work experience, or Ph.D new graduate majoring in machine learning or data science
•    Deep knowledge of mathematics in general and probability and statistics in particular, deep knowledge of computer science especially algorithm design
•    Familiarity with commonly used machine learning frameworks (such as TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, etc) and libraries (such as Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc)
•    Familiarity with both classical data analysis (such as classification, regression, clustering, etc) and deep learning models (CNN, LSTM, Autoencoder, GAN, Attention, RL, Metric learning, Multi-task Learning, etc)
•    Excellent programming ability to code with Python and/or other languages for data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, model simulation and generic automation
•    Passionate team player with excellent communication skills, self-motivated quick learner with open mind and courage to be challenged with new knowledge and skills 

Preferred Requirements:
•    Knowledge and experience with machine learning at scale on big data platforms (e.g. PySpark with Apache ecosystems or AWS EMR) is a big plus
•    Knowledge and experience with modern software development methodology and workflow (especially Kubernetes container orchestration) is a big plus
•    Knowledge and experience of 5G technology, especially connected vehicle communication systems (C-V2X) and mobile edge computing is a plus

title: Software Engineer
description:
Job Description : SPAN_MLP_2020_2 

Project Description:

  • The IOT/AI project is a research and development activity of a new generation architectural dynamic window glass [IOT Device] that intelligently adjusts in response to external conditions and user preferences, enabling unparalleled control over the amount of light and heat that enters a building. The project focuses on smart windows that let in natural light, views and also enhance mental and physical wellbeing by significantly reducing headaches, eyestrain and drowsiness.
  • Dynamic/Smart Glasses [IOT Device] provides continuously unobstructed views without heat or glare, creating a new level of occupant comfort and natural light while dramatically reducing building energy consumption. In addition, these dynamic windows reduce glare and heat, improving the energy efficiency of buildings by 20 percent.

Job Description:

  • Identify valuable data sources and automate data collection processes
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Run machine learning tests and experiments
  • Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results

  • Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze Machine learning model performance and accuracy.
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using python.
  • Liaise with internal teams to identify system requirements
  • Investigate the causes of non-conforming software.
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases.
  • Protecting data, software, and hardware by coordinating, planning and implementing network security measures.
  • Designing and implementing new network solutions and/or improving the efficiency of current networks
  • Provide recommendations for continuous improvement.

Responsibility:

  • Work closely with dev teams to cultivate a quality culture, Think out of the box in terms of development & testing and propose solutions to the challenges as required.
  • Build effective and maintainable development software and automation
  • Suggest improvements to current process, automation, test suite and innovate
  • Prepare development and automation reports and work closely with test lead for progress report
  • Communicate effectively with your team members and developers

Basic Qualification

  • At least 1+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one language such as python, C/C++ including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or related field

Preferred Qualifications

  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or related field
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
  • Proficiency in two or more programming languages such as C/C++, Python, Scala, Golang, R, Matlab
  • Experience in data mining and pre-processing of structured and unstructured data and build/Validate predictive machine learning models and algorithms.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, Factor analysis, Cluster analysis, etc.)
  • Experience in design, development and execution of automation scripts to perform A/B testing

  • Understanding of network routing & switching, security issues, flow control, congestion control, QoS, and other networking concepts.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving ability along with the ability to troubleshoot and identify issues with complex distributed cloud computing systems
  • Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (Django, Flask or Pyramid)
  • Knowledge of user authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments.
  • Understanding of advanced design principles behind a scalable application
  • Experience working with various data stores such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, also distributed databases such as Cassandra.

title: Senior Embedded Engineer -Networking Domain
description:
• 5-10 years of relevant work experience in embedded software development using the C/C++ language

Must be a subject matter expert (SME) in one or more of the following areas:
• Linux kernel networking stack knowledge (Netdevice, SKB, IP Conntrack, OVS)
• Linux network device driver/data-path performance expertise

  • The role will be in the area of embedded C programming on our Linux based platforms, and will be developing features within the open source OpenSync itself, as well as some of our target/platform layers where needed.
  • A deep understanding of networking protocols is a must -- bonus if they also have experience related with L4-L7 DPI.
  • We require senior level people who can handle project management of their own tasks, while providing weekly updates and meeting various check-points through-out the projects.

We are a Test Driven Development (TDD) style company.  This means that any new project must come with unit tests (UTs), as well as for end-to-end features that have cloud control through OVSDB all the way down to the SoC or networking layer of the platform also require functional unit tests (FUTs).   Having an engineer who is experienced with unit testing as part of the development process is what we're looking for.
